content: a lil batty crochet pattern by ashley maglich/your craft gremlin ©ashleymaglich this pattern is for your personal use do not share any portions of this pattern in any form for others to use you are 100% free to sell any physical items made with this pattern please feel free to tag me @ashleymaglich or link to the pattern in any posts or mentions of thank you so much for your support i look forward to seeing what you create abbreviations us terms ● chain - chain ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● 1/2dc -half_double_crochet ● tc - treble_crochet ● slip_stitch - slip stich ● picot ● fo - fasten_off materials yarn crochet hook *in tutorial i used 2 20mm* scissors darning needle - to sew in ends ©ashleymaglich in this tutorial for visual purposes i am using a size 3 2 20mm crochet hook & worsted weight yarn however in my bat windspinner on my youtube channel shorts i used a 12 1 00mm crochet hook with embroidery floss i am going to be referring to the process in this pattern as steps vs row or rounds step 1 ch15 ©ashleymaglich step 2 double_crochet in the 4th chain from the hook step 3 double_crochet in the next stitch 2dc in the next double_crochet in the next 2 stitches ©ashleymaglich step 4 double_crochet tc in the next stitch tc double_crochet in the next ©ashleymaglich step 5 double_crochet in the next 2 stitches 2 double_crochet in the next double_crochet in the next 2dc in the next ©ashleymaglich step 6 *now you will slip_stitch in the side of the last double_crochet in the middle of that stitch then you will slip stitch over again to reach the bottom of that stitch that you slip stitched into ©ashleymaglich step 7 once you are in that chain space you are going to slip_stitch in the next 5 stitches to reach the first treble_crochet that you made ©ashleymaglich we will now be making the ears of the bat step 8 - ears *make a picot ch3 slip_stitch in 1st chain single_crochet back into that same stitch* *slip_stitch to the next stitch & repeat to make the second ear ©ashleymaglich ©ashleymaglich step 9 slip_stitch in the next 5 stitches until you reach the end once you reach the end you are going to slip_stitch into the side of the double_crochet then slip_stitch again into the next available stitch ©ashleymaglich *we are now working on the bottom of the bat step 10 in that same stitch single_crochet ½ double_crochet make a ch2 picot ½ double_crochet single_crochet *all in the same stitch ©ashleymaglich step 11 single_crochet in the next 2 stitches single_crochet ½ double_crochet make a ch2 picot ½ double_crochet single_crochet *all in the next stitch ©ashleymaglich step 12 single_crochet in the next 3 stitches ½ double_crochet double_crochet make a ch2 picot in the next stitch double_crochet ½ double_crochet in the next stitch ©ashleymaglich step 13 single_crochet in the next 3 stitches ©ashleymaglich single_crochet ½ double_crochet make a ch2 picot
